publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2327 David McLetchie: Binny House, Ecclesmachan, West Lothian-That the Parliament notes with concern the current financial crisis at the Sue Ryder Care home, Binny House, Ecclesmachan, West Lothian, which provides intensive residential support and respite care for sufferers of degenerative disorders such as multiple sclerosis and Parkinson's Disease and calls on the Scottish Executive, Lothian Health and the local authorities which use the facility to co-operate with Sue Ryder Care in seeking to avert the threatened closure of the home. Supported by: Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*
S1M-2327 Binny House, Ecclesmachan, West Lothian (lodged on 16 October 2001) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2327 Binny House, Ecclesmachan, West Lothian (lodged on 16 October 2001) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Phil Gallie*, Bill Aitken*
S1M-2327 Binny House, Ecclesmachan, West Lothian (lodged on 16 October 2001) David Mundell*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Mr Murray Tosh*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*
S1M-2327 Binny House, Ecclesmachan, West Lothian (lodged on 16 October 2001) Donald Gorrie*, John Young*, Murdo Fraser*, Mr Keith Harding*
S1M-2327 Binny House, Ecclesmachan, West Lothian (lodged on 16 October 2001) John Scott*
S1M-2327 Binny House, Ecclesmachan, West Lothian (lodged on 16 October 2001) Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-2327 Binny House, Ecclesmachan, West Lothian (lodged on 16 October 2001) Stewart Stevenson*
S1M-2327 Binny House, Ecclesmachan, West Lothian (lodged on 16 October 2001) Mr Kenny MacAskill*
